WRITING.TITLE: [EVOLVE CWC Spoiler] New Entrant in WWE Cruiserweight Classic
WRITING.TEXT: Due to Tony Nese winning the flash point elimination match tonight at EVOLVE 63, he has earned a spot in the Cruiserweight Classic.

I don't really live my life for Internet points. I was sourcing and then put the story in the comments, like I've done for every PWI article I've posted before. I know people don't like to go the site but I'm also not going to take traffic away from a site I use a lot if someone happens to want to go there.

WRITING.TITLE: WWE Game Night: Chubby Bunny Challenge

WRITING.TEXT:
Former WWE World Heavyweight champion Daniel Bryan was backstage at the WWE NXT TV last night, PWInsider.com has confirmed. Bryan was visiting with the roster and watched the majority of the show from the gorilla position backstage.
It was the first time Bryan has been in attendance at a WWE event since retiring live on Raw on 2/8 in Seattle.
Bryan had been advertised since then for appearances at several live events that would have featured a "Daniel Bryan Appreciation Night" theme as well as a signing at Wrestlemania AXXESS, but was pulled from those dates at his request just as they were about to begin. At the time, WWE's comment was that Bryan had been given "requested time off."
Bryan's visit backstage also allowed him a chance to reunite with EVOLVE's Gabe Sapolsky, who was also at the taping. The two worked very closely together during their time in Ring of Honor and the original incarnation of EVOLVE was the brain-child of the pair.
Bryan will be taking part in the E! reality series "Total Bellas" this fall, featuring himself and Brie Bella moving into John Cena's home in Tampa, helping Nikki Bella recover from neck surgery. Bryan's retirement and life after wrestling will be featured on the show.
Bryan's social media shows that while in Florida, he took part in a workout at the WWE Performance Center.

WRITING.TITLE: Daniel Bryan backstage at NXT TV Tapings (Story In Comments)

WRITING.TEXT: Dolph's... being there was probably one of the loudest reactions I've ever been apart of. I feel like everyone in the crowd was jumping up and down in excitement.
Thought New Day would lose cause Xavier was in the match.
If you turn off JavaScript it makes the site load really fast and blocks some ads just off doing that.

RoH Supercard of Honor VII in New York for Wrestlemania weekend. We actually had tickets, got there late, had terrible seats where we couldn't see anything thanks to a lighting rig. I was down for standing the whole time somewhere else... The girlfriend, not so much. Got in a fight with her and then decided to give up the ghost. Jay Briscoe wins title and I get pretty depressed I missed out on someone I've watched for 11 years win a title that rarely changes hands.

WRITING.TITLE: What has been the hardest part about being in a long term relationship?

WRITING.TEXT: So has your keyboard apparently.

What actually should be done is instead of running a split crew every weekend for house shows they should run one crew and give the weekend off to the others, and then do the opposite crew the next week. That way you only work every other weekend and every Monday and Tuesday. That alone would take a good amount off on people's bodies.

WRITING.TITLE: Kevin Martenson (aka Johnny Goodtime) signs with Lucha Underground

WRITING.TEXT: I believe the show was Unscripted 2. Probably not being printed anymore but you should be able to find it somewhere.

At an RoH show in Long Island Kevin Steen was wrestling someone and was throwing punches... Someone yells, "punch him in the ear!!" And Steen does. Ten seconds later a different fan yells, "punch him in the dick!!" Steen takes a second, shrugs and gets on his knees and punches him in the crotch.
You sure seem to know how to run a business there buddy

I can't help but cry reading when anyone writes something like this... I can relate too much. It's all I ever wanted as well and leaving wrestling school is the biggest regret of my life. From the videotape of SummerSlam 1988 to today and many years to come this is my passion. It'll never leave me and has been the only thing that has consistently been a part of me and made me me.
To everyone working this show and who has in the past thank you.

He left immediately after they cut the camera away. Shook hands with fans on the way back. I highly doubt he's not signed I doubt WWE want to bring anymore people who are known nationally (or around that) and not have them locked in, just so there's not another James Storm type deal.
I was there and right when they wrapped the pre-show and were taking that set down right before the dark matches he was on the floor. So weird seeing him smiling and laughing.

Heh it's true. I'm an elite subscriber and I accidentally always go to post the elite link and then remember it won't work for everyone. Going to get the regular site link annoys the hell out of me on my phone. I block Java on my laptop to make it bearable.

We have heard from several sources that former TNA champion Bobby Roode is in Dallas, Texas and was spotted at the WWE hotel this afternoon.
Given that Roode wasn't scheduled for any appearances this weekend in Dallas, that is a most interesting development. Stay tuned.

Hey guys, been to EVOLVE during Wrestlemania weekend 2 out of the last 3 years I've been doing this trip. It's pretty laid back, arrive go in and sit. There's no real lines or anything. It's always been just walk in when doors open and find your section or find a seat in GA.
I'll be there again tomorrow as well. Have fun guys, should be a pretty killer show.
We used Uber from the hotel to our Airbnb and it was a minivan, you guys should be fine regardless.

Karl Anderson and Doc Gallows - The Bullet Club - are scheduled to be at this week's WWE TV Tapings, PWInsider.com has confirmed with multiple sources. It''s expected they will be at Wrestlemania, at least backstage at the event, as well.
As we had reported previously, the pair were expected to debut on the main WWE roster, bypassing NXT, in late March/early April. It appears their debut is imminent.
The belief is that the team will be using The Balor Club name.
Also others feel free to use this thread as a means to find people for ride sharing if you want to offset the cost of the surge pricing if you're going the Uber route.

WRITING.TITLE: For those staying in Dallas
WRITING.TEXT:
How are you getting to AT T Stadium? I'm still trying to find the best way there and also the cheapest. Willing to share an Uber with other people and split the cost, would just be me and my GF.
Let me know what you all have set up so I can weigh the options.
Hey I'm right next to ya! 319 for me.

Yeah that's what I'm saying. That place isn't run like any kind of television writing room. Even on TV you have a show runner who has final say as far as direction, but they give you the freedom of finding your own way there.
It's tough and demoralizing when you think you have a good idea and something that can tell a great story and then someone just shits on it and you can't even argue your case.
I'll give HHH credit though because the team he has working on NXT is a lot better at overall storytelling then what the main roster has. My best comparison is main roster stories are more like your broadcast network shows. NXT is more akin to your basic cable writing, which I think is just easier to digest in the current world we live in where people are looking for more depth in getting from point A to point B in a story.

I'm just begging someone to even try messing with continuity there... And ya know I'm not going to sit here and pretend I know what it's like to work there. I'm sure it's madness. I'm sure there is good ideas and then they get scrapped cause someone higher up scraps it.

They need to stop looking for people with actual experience in TV and film writing... It's a whole different beast to write wrestling storylines. I get that the experience can keep things tidy or whatever, but they need people who care about wrestling and have a true passion for the actual art of wrestling. I don't need rehashed sitcom storylines from every broadcast network. You can find someone who has great ideas for wrestling and mold them into a neat and tidy writer. Start out being an idea person and work with someone who can write and edit for you and then after 6 months you're free to format for yourself. On the job training.
Or just find me the new Chris Kreski and all will be forgiven.
The Morning Of...
